a steady/gradual decline

senses.definition: to make something look more attractive by putting things on it

senses.definition: to be placed on something in order to make it look more attractive

senses.definition: the act or process of decorating something such as the inside of a house by painting it, etc.
an award or medal that is given to somebody as an honour

senses.definition: protecting somebody/something against attack

senses.definition: a part of a surface that is lower than the parts around it

senses.definition: information or a fact that is made known or public that was previously secret or private

senses.definition: an amount of money that is taken off the usual cost of something

You can get a substantial discount off your car insurance.
They were selling everything at a discount (= at reduced prices).
a chance to buy new shares at a discount to the current trading price

a discount voucher/coupon/card
a discount store/retailer (= one that regularly sells goods at reduced prices)
a discount airline/carrier (= an airline that sells cheap tickets)

senses.definition: to take an amount of money off the usual cost of something; to sell something at a discount

examples.en: Most of our stock has been discounted by up to 40 per cent.
discounted rates/fares

The newspaper will discount its cover price this week.

senses.definition: to think or say that something is not important or not true

senses.definition: to try to prevent something or to prevent somebody from doing something, especially by making it difficult to do or by showing that you do not approve of it

senses.definition: to make somebody feel less confident or enthusiastic about doing something

senses.definition: the use of language in speech and writing in order to produce meaning; language that is studied, usually in order to see how the different parts of a text are connected

examples.en: spoken/written discourse

senses.definition: to be the first person to become aware that a particular place or thing exists

a newly discovered snake species

senses.definition: to find somebody/something that was hidden or that you did not expect to find

examples.en: Police discovered a large stash of drugs while searching the house.

He was later discovered to be seriously ill.

senses.definition: an act or the process of finding somebody/something, or learning about something that was not known about before

examples.en: Researchers in this field have made some important new discoveries.

the discovery of new talent in the art world

The film takes us on a journey of discovery to different parts of the globe.

In 1974 Hawking made the discovery (= he discovered) that black holes give off radiation.

senses.definition: a thing, fact or person that is found or learned about for the first time

one of the most important scientific discoveries of all time
potentially the biggest archaeological discovery in Norway for fifty years
recent discoveries about sleep

senses.definition: the freedom or power to decide what should be done in a particular situation

examples.en: I'll leave it up to you to use your discretion.

senses.definition: care in what you say or do, in order to keep something secret or to avoid causing difficulty for somebody or making them feel embarrassed; the quality of being discreet

examples.en: This is confidential, but I know that I can rely on your discretion.

senses.definition: according to what somebody decides or wishes to do

examples.en: Bail is granted at the discretion of the court.

idioms.word: discretion is the better part of valour

senses.definition: you should avoid danger and not take unnecessary risks
the practice of treating somebody or a particular group in society less fairly than others

examples.en: age/racial/gender/sex discrimination (= because of somebody’s age, race, gender or sex)
discrimination against the elderly
discrimination in favour of the young

examples.cf: discrimination on the basis of something

examples.cf: discrimination on the grounds of something
examples.en: legislation to ban discrimination on the grounds of age

senses.definition: the ability to judge what is good, true, etc.

examples.en: He showed great discrimination in his choice of friends.

senses.definition: the ability to recognize a difference between one thing and another; a difference that is recognized

examples.en: to learn discrimination between right and wrong

senses.definition: to talk about something with somebody, especially in order to decide something

to discuss the issue/matter/topic
to discuss a plan/proposal

senses.definition: to write or talk about something in detail, showing the different ideas and opinions about it

examples.en: This topic will be discussed at greater length in the next chapter.

senses.definition: a conversation about somebody/something; the process of discussing somebody/something

examples.en: I discovered something interesting during a family discussion.

We want to encourage public discussion of mental health issues.

examples.cf: discussion among/between A and B (about somebody/something)

a list of topics for discussion
to stimulate/provoke discussion
to initiate/start/spark a discussion
a panel/group/round-table discussion

examples.en: I have chosen to focus my discussion on a single work.

See chapter 15 for a detailed discussion of the approach used.

to spread/transmit a disease

patients with coronary heart disease
cardiovascular/pulmonary/respiratory disease

senses.definition: something that is very wrong with people’s attitudes, way of life or with society

a casserole dish

senses.definition: the plates, bowls, cups, etc. that have been used for a meal and need to be washed

examples.en: I'll do the dishes (= wash them).

senses.definition: food prepared in a particular way as part of a meal

examples.en: a vegetarian/fish/meat/pasta dish

a savoury dish of curried rice and lamb

senses.definition: any object that is like a dish or bowl in shape

senses.definition: a sexually attractive person

senses.definition: a thin flat round object

variants.html: (also magnetic disk)

senses.definition: to not like somebody/something

senses.definition: the act of sending somebody away or allowing them to leave
the end of the innings of a player or team

help for people with alcohol use disorder

a display of photographs
a display window/stand/board

variants.html: (also garbage disposal (both North American English), waste disposal unit, waste disposer (both British English))

available for use as you prefer/somebody prefers

variants.html: (British English also within spitting distance)

senses.definition: very close

senses.definition: far away in space or time

senses.definition: not like something else

senses.definition: related to you but not closely

senses.definition: not friendly; not wanting a close relationship with somebody

examples.en: Pat sounded very cold and distant on the phone.

senses.definition: not paying attention to something but thinking about something completely different

senses.definition: a long time ago

examples.en: stories from the dim and distant past

idioms.word: in the not too distant future

senses.definition: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

senses.definition: clearly different or of a different kind

senses.definition: to perform two roles or functions at the same time

examples.en: This device can pull double duty as a decent laptop and an adequate tablet.
She deserves credit for serving double duty as a host and performer.

senses.definition: while doing a job

examples.en: A police officer was injured in the line of duty yesterday.

senses.definition: working/not working at a particular time

examples.en: Who's on duty today?
What time do you go off duty?
You're not allowed to make personal phone calls on duty.

senses.definition: a disk on which large amounts of information, especially films, photographs and video, can be stored, for use on a DVD player or computer (the abbreviation for ‘digital versatile disc’ or ‘digital videodisc’)

examples.en: Let's just stay in and watch a DVD.
a DVD recorder
a DVD drive
Is it available on DVD yet?

senses.definition: having a lot of energy and a strong personality

examples.en: a dynamic leader
He was a dynamic young advertising executive.
She has a dynamic personality.

senses.definition: always changing and making progress

examples.en: The business has managed to change and remain dynamic.
These countries are characterized by highly dynamic economies.

senses.definition: producing movement
describing an action rather than a state. Dynamic verbs (for example eat, grow, knock, die) can be used in the progressive tenses.

variants.html: dynamics

senses.definition: the way in which people or things behave and react to each other in a particular situation

examples.en: the dynamics of political change
group dynamics (= the way in which members of a group react to each other)
Market dynamics are working in the company’s favour.

variants.html: dynamics

senses.definition: the science of the forces involved in movement

examples.en: fluid dynamics

senses.definition: a force that produces change, action or effects

variants.html: dynamics

senses.definition: changes in volume in music

examples.en: They play all the notes in the right place and have a scrupulous regard for the tempos and dynamics.
